p: An amount of 100 g of R. acaule flowers freshly collected were cut in small pieces and submitted to hydrodistillation for 5–6 h with 500 ml of boiling distilled water using a Clevenger-type apparatus [ 17] in accordance with the European Pharmacopeia. The distilled essential oil was dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate, transferred to sealed dark vials and stored at 4 °C until use. The yield (0.018%) was calculated based on the fresh weight of the sample.
